health_issues.description: Depression is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. It causes feelings of sadness and/or a loss of interest in activities once enjoyed. It can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems and can decrease a personâ€™s ability to function at work and home.
symptoms: Loss of interest in hobbies and activities
Difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions

health_issues.description: Anxiety disorders are a group of mental disorders characterized by significant feelings of anxiety and fear. Anxiety is a normal response to stress, but when it becomes excessive and interferes with daily life, it can be considered a disorder. There are several types of anxiety disorders, including generalized anxiety disorder, panic disorder, and social anxiety disorder.
symptoms: Restlessness or feeling keyed up or on edge
Difficulty concentrating or mind going blank
Panic attacks (sudden onset of fear or discomfort that reaches a peak within minutes)

health_issues.description: Bipolar disorder, also known as manic-depressive illness, is a brain disorder that causes unusual shifts in mood, energy, activity levels, and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks. Symptoms can be severe and include episodes of mania and depression.
symptoms: Manic episodes (periods of elevated or irritable mood, increased energy, decreased need for sleep, racing thoughts, impulsivity)
Depressive episodes (periods of low mood, decreased energy, feelings of worthlessness or guilt, difficulty concentrating, thoughts of death or suicide)

health_issues.description: Diabetes is a chronic condition that affects how your body processes blood sugar (glucose). It is characterized by high levels of glucose in the blood, which can lead to a variety of health problems over time.

symptoms: Numbness or tingling in hands or feet
